greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The length of a shortest path from n to a power of 2, when applying the nondeterministic maps k -> k - k/p and  k -> k + k/p, where p can be any of the odd prime factors of k, and the maps can be applied in any order.
comment: The length of a shortest path from n to a power of 2, when using the transitions x -> A171462(x) and x -> A335876(x) in any order.

a((2^e)-1) is equal to A046051(e) = A001222((2^e)-1) when e is either a Mersenne exponent (in A000043), or some other number: 1, 4, 6, 8, 16, 32. For example, 32 is present because 2^32 - 1 = 4294967295 = 3*5*17*257*65537, a squarefree product of five known Fermat primes. - _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 11 2020
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Fully additive with a(2) = 0, and a(p) = 1+min(a(p-1), a(p+1)), for odd primes p.
For all n >= 0, a(A000244(n)) = n, and these also seem to give records.
example: A335876(67) = 68, and A171462(68) = 64 = 2^6, and this is the shortest path from 67 to a power of 2, thus a(67) = 2.
program: A335885(n) = if(A209229(n),0,my(xs=Set([n]),newxs,a,b,u); for(k=1,oo, newxs=Set([]); for(i=1,#xs,u = xs[i]; a = A171462(u); if(A209229(a), return(k)); b = A335876(u); if(A209229(b), return(k)); newxs = setunion([a],newxs); newxs = setunion([b],newxs)); xs = newxs));
xref: Cf. A000079, A335911, A335912 (positions of 0's, 1's and 2's in this sequence) and array A335910.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jun 29 2020
